meanings.sent1: She ate inordinately fast, finishing her meal in mere minutes.
meanings.sent2: He inordinately worried about the upcoming test, unable to sleep the night before.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel inordinately hoarded acorns, filling its nest to the brim.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed inordinately loud in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The sun beat down inordinately hot on the hikers, making them seek shade.

meanings.definition: To an unusually or disproportionately large degree
meanings.sent1: The flowers inordinately bloomed after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The students inordinately celebrated their victory with cheers and high-fives.
meanings.sent3: The cat inordinately purred when its owner returned home, showing its happiness.
meanings.sent4: The music inordinately filled the room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: Her smile inordinately brightened the room, spreading joy to everyone around.
